item.title: He's In! **UPDATES**
item.description: Even though he spoke the words much earlier during the Tonight Show’s taping, just moments ago, Americans heard it for the first time. “I am running for President of the United States,” Fred told Jay Leno. If the audience in NBC’s Burbank studios represented a cross-section of the US, then Fred’s announcement is a welcome one. The audience went wild. I got the feeling Fred was a little tight just around the time he said he’s running.

item.title: You're Supposed to be Watching Leno
item.description: Fred Thompson will appear as a guest on the Tonight Show with Jay Leno tonight. Don’t miss it. How often do you get to see the next President of the United States announce his candidacy live on a late night talk show?

item.title: Maybe We Need a Lazy President
item.description: The MSM are tripping over themselves to publish stories about Fred Thompson’s supposed laziness. Newsweek decided to make the accusation head on (from CNN.com): [A]s he prepares to formally begin his campaign for the White House this week, after months of “testing the waters,” the conventional wisdom in Washington is that Thompson doesn’t want it badly enough, isn’t willing to work hard enough-put bluntly, that he is lazy. Newsweek: Grin and Bear It

item.title: Thompson Gaining Social Conservatives
